Reviews.Title: Good, but look a little higher!
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: This camera is overall pretty good and has a competitive MSRP. However, be sure to consider the older but higher-end Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP8. When Panasonic came out with the new FP1 and FP3 (the touchscreen version of the FP1), I was hoping they would be the same as the well-reviewed FP8 but with an improved look and a lens cover. Well, I was slightly disappointed.Let's forget the gimmicky touchscreen FP3 and compare the FP1 to the FP8. The FP1 is $40 cheaper than the FP8 regarding market price (as of when I wrote this review) but it has:-0.6x less zoom (4.0x rather than 4.6x)-Mega OIS rather than Power OIS (Panasonic claims Power is 2x better, maybe dubious)-No wide-angle lens (35mm rather than 28mm)-80 shots less per battery charge (300 rather than 380)-No zoom during video recordingPersonally, that last drawback breaks the deal for me as I need the best video recording experience possible (and I've found that the FP8 has THE best 720p quality in point-and-shoot cameras under $200). But it's up to you on whether those drawbacks are worth the $40 savings.

Reviews.Title: Consumer Reports Best Buy
Reviews.Author: Blake
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera solely on Consumer Reports ratings.  I wanted a slim camera to carry in my pocket at parties, events, etc. with friends.  I am not doing any "professional" photos, just fun pics.  This camera is AWESOME!!!  It is about $100 cheaper than comparable Nikon and Sony cameras, it does great with night pics, some movement, etc.  I post all my party pics on FB and everyone talks about how good they turned out.  I LOVE this camera!!  Can't be beat for the price!  Consumer Reports knows what they were talking about.  :)

Reviews.Title: Neat little camera
Reviews.Author: Nukepr
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera to carry around for capturing images that come up while driving along or visiting somewhere. I have a Nikon SLR that I use for planned photographs, but this is a great camera to carry around for picture opportunities that pop up unexpectedly. It is small and very easy to use, and it has a rechargable battery that seems to have a very long cycle between charges. It uses a SDHC card that holds more pictures than you are likely to take before you download them, and the image quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: Lumix FP1 is like shooting thru a Smoke Screen
Reviews.Author: Bears Fan Jim "qm2-703"
Reviews.Content: Do you wonder why the FP1 price has dropped to $79 from about $109 in the past 3 weeks ? (What was it a couple of months ago, about $169 !! )  I think I know why.  I tried two different ones, and both have terrible glare on the lens and the glare has the same effect as if you were in a smoke-filled room !! This is true indoors, worse of course outdoors, and even is very visible in its videos. Its pictures look as though they need a polarizing filter...And if that weren't enough, the low-light ability w/o flash is just pitiful. So very disappointing compared to what I expected from Panasonic.  Ok for $79, but it never should have started any higher.All its pretty bells and whistles and durable body cant help.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the size and price
Reviews.Author: lisa
Reviews.Content: I have a Panasonic DMC TZ3. It's a bulkier model but gets a 60x zoom, quite large for still a non-DSLR pocket camera. I liked the Lumix line by Panasonic. After playing with many ultra compact models in the store (Samsung TL205 with dual view and Samsung TL105), I decided this was the way to go! I am happy thus far. Please, let me say I am no expert, but I have had 5-6 digital cameras and can compare.The good:  zooms up to 33.8x, which is HUGE for a camera this size (the optical zoom is internal! takes up no space but quite effective)  lots of scenes and modes to choose from  super small size (0.7" wide), smaller than my blackberry phone!  lightweight  sliding the cover down is an easy and quick power on, makes catching the 'right' moment easier when you don't have a long start up  very quick when using a SDXC card, class 4 or the higher the better  selects and determines the best scene and shot for you  speaker for playback of films is actually quite goodThe Bad:  menu and scene selection is not as easy to go through as other models, needs a clicker or round changer on the unit itself (like choosing to film a movie, you must go through menu rather than hitting a button)  quite grainy and noisy in some modes, almost unusable. just have to find right onesThe Indifferent:  the camera colors are a little funky, choose wisely  when pressing buttons, you can notice a slightly 'cheaper' feel than others (the sound, the feel, etc.)Overall it's a good, solid camera. I dont know if I would use it as my only camera because I personally like a nice, big zoom, but definitely a nice addition to the collection. Definitely great for beginners, people who take pics with friends, and casual shooting. It's no DSLR, but a good, daily pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: R. Whitehead
Reviews.Content: We used this camera on a recent trip to San Francisco and it worked great.  The pictures were in focus, the color was good and we were very satisfied with its performance.  Never had a problem with the battery, just charged it up each night even though it was far from being depleted.  The controls are easy to use and intuitive if you've used a digital camera before.  It's small, about the size of a deck of cards, so it fit in my shirt pocket or my wife's tiny purse without any problems and feels solid so you can take it with you everywhere.If your a professional photographer, you might want something better, but if you just want pictures of your vacation and the family for pictures or screen savers, this camera is hard to beat and it's a lot easier to haul around than the big "professional" cameras.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic FP1
Reviews.Author: John R. Crossan Jr.
Reviews.Content: My wife bought this camera through Amazon for Christmas for me.I needed a camera that was small enough to carry in my pocket and easy to use in the woods. After spending hours reading reviews and researching I determined this was the one I wanted.I have only taken a couple of pictures and one video with it just to try it out. The pics were in dim lit areas so I used the intellashot feature on the camera and all I can say is wow! My very exspensive Sony snapshot camera doesn't take pics as crisp and clear as this little camera does and for less than $80 bucks. I can't wait to take it out in the woods with me when the weather gets warmer and it will be with us on our next vacation. For taking snapshots and for the money this little camera can't be beat in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures and movies
Reviews.Author: dc_x
Reviews.Content: I've owned my DMC-FP1 for a few months now. It's my first proper digital camera and I'm very happy with it. I bought it because I thought it offered the best value-for-money in the sub-$150 range. It takes 12 MP still pictures and 720p movies, and is very light and thin. I bought a 8 GB SD card to go with the camera for about $20.The picture quality is very good, and I like the way I can zoom in to the pictures on my computer and see details that initially aren't visible. When you look really close up, though, (at the pixel level) you can see the limitations of the camera, with a lack of detail and slightly odd color effects but these aren't noticeable when you zoom out. Another issue is that the image is a little distorted. E.g., if you take a picture of a straight line, the line will look a little curved in the final picture.The video quality is very good and compares favourably with my wife's Flip camera (which was more expensive!). The Panasonic has image stabilization which the Flip doesn't, but the performance in dark conditions seems a bit worse for the Panasonic.The lens has a large cover that slides up and down, and which you can just move by pushing your finger against it. This works very well, and is easier than pressing a button.Note that there is a DMC-FP3 model which is more expensive, has a touch-screen interface and takes 14 MP pictures. It was about $80 more than the FP1, and I didn't think the extra features were worth the difference.Overall I'm happy with the camera, and I recommend it to anybody else looking for a cheap camera that takes good pictures and movies.

Reviews.Title: Great point-and-shoot for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Levine
Reviews.Content: This little camera is great for carrying around on a trip or to take pics of kids. It is portable, the battery lasts a long time, and it has a lot of options. I am able to use it for normal snapshots and also manually adjust settings for good pictures in extreme light. I also like the ability to choose how it decides to focus if I want to bother. Picture quality seems good so far.I got it on sale for $120 from Amazon and its definitely worth it so far.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price
Reviews.Author: davjau "davjau"
Reviews.Content: So I was looking for a small basic, point and shoot to accompany my Nikon SLR when I didn't need to lug it around.  I ordered 3 cameras from Amazon.  This panasonic model, canon sd1300, casio exilim ex-h5.  I sent the other two back and kept this one.  And it was the cheapest of all three!. I chose these three based off online reviews and consumer reports.  I was very dissapointed with the canon.  It was the worst of all three.  The casio was okay but the quality of pictures didn't seem that much better than this panasonic, and it was priced about $60 more.This is the best camera I think you could find for the value.  It allows you to make several setting adjustments or just use automatic.  Either way it is a great camera. It is small, thin, light weight and takes relatively good pictures for a point and shoot.  It shoots 720p HD video which is nice as well.  I was skeptical about this until I put it up against the canon and casio.Great camera!

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: P. Sacco
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my "tween" daughter and she has loved it.  The picture quality is great (not awesome, but definitely takes decent shots), and she likes that it also takes video.  It didn't take her long to figure out how to toggle between video and photo mode, which was something that I had noted as a potential problem from other comments before I purchased the item, so I don't think that should be a big concern for the shopper.  Definitely no regrets on this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great device for the price!
Reviews.Author: BlueZenOrnge
Reviews.Content: For about $120.00 you can't really go wrong with this little point-n-shoot, as long as a little point-n-shoot is all you desire. This camera has worked great for me as a pocket tag along for some timeless party shots or any situation where you would normally be cursing yourself for not having a camera. While this little shooter can't handle intense national geographic quality image capturing, it has produced some good quality pics for me. It takes some extra adjusting with the settings (which there are more of than I expected for such a bargain camera) in order to get a real real quality shot, but it can be done without too much know how. The battery is working great as well. I'm satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Pansonic Lumix DMC FP1 - Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Marnie H "Desert Wanderer"
Reviews.Content: I've shot about 1,000 photos with this little camera in the past month. Overall the quality has been great - a couple of pictures had strange lines running through them, but that could be something Im doing since it only happened on about 10 pictures out of the 1,000. I love the small size - it is easy to just put it in my pocket and take it along with me wherever I go.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: C. Mcgovern "CM"
Reviews.Content: This camera is the best "thin" camera I have ever used. It has great optical zoom, and really takes nice pictures. Obviously the tiny flash makes night pictures not the best, but with night portrait mode takes ok image quality. Takes good portraits. I use auto most of the time, but this camera really takes nicer pictures if you preset one of the scene modes. The camera is very small and convenient to take with you. The price is great. I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommended
Reviews.Author: photonomenal
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera after reading several reviews.  First, I was torn between Cannon cameras and Panasonic cameras, but ultimately chose Panasonic because of the quality for the price.  Then, I was looking for something simple and thin.  The biggest problem with my old digital camera (besides it being pretty outdated, since it was one of the first digital camera to come out) was that is was big and bulky.  So I didn't take it with me that much since it took up so much room in my purse.  Thin and Sleek are the perfect words to describe this camera, I take it everywhere with me now.  Finally, I wasn't looking for anything fancy.  With advancing technology, digital cameras have become quite sophisticated.  However, I just wanted something simple to use, and this camera is just that!  I haven't even looked at the user's guide yet and I've taken quite a few pics already.  So, if you are looking for something easy to use and easy to carry around, I highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: OrangeFan
Reviews.Content: I analyze EVERYTHING! Researched comparable cameras in this price range for weeks before selecting this camera for my wife for Christmas. Wanted a simple small point and shoot that would take decent pictures - this camera delivers! Easy to operate and takes nice pics. Great camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Good product, good price.
Reviews.Author: Edwin V. Maier "Happy Owner"
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this camera. Very handy and small enough for the shirt pocket. Easy menu, but takes time to go from normal scenery pictures to where the double flash is for red eye reduction on people's faces. (Not too much of a problem after getting used to it.) Really like the idea of a sliding lens cover that is also the on-off switch. All-in-all, I'm pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price.
Reviews.Author: Stef "thatgirlstef"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for my mother, who is pretty technologically... well, dumb. She, however, was very excited when she opened it and quickly learned to use it with ease. She now loves to take photos, upload them to her computer, and emails them to me often. My father, who has nerve damage and shakes uncontrollably, can also take clear, beautiful shots because of the awesome image stabilization. The pictures come out gorgeous, and the camera is very easy to use/navigate! Would definitely reccomend!

Reviews.Title: This camera take awesome video for the price.
Reviews.Author: Larry A. Ledford
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on a cruise rather than take along my DSLR.  It is also easy to put in your pocket to carry every day.  The camera turns on by simply sliding the cover down.  The menu is simple or you can just hit the iA button and you are ready to go.  What blew me away was the quality of the video and audio in video mode.  I shot some short segments of a violin, cello, piano trio just sitting in my audience seat with available light.  I think it turned out great.  You can get on Facebook and search for THURSDAY MUSIC CLUB to view the video. Be sure to comment or "like" it if you go there.  I think it is superior to my Flip video camera.Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver) This is a great sub $100 camera

Reviews.Title: A great little low cost camera
Reviews.Author: Bazza
Reviews.Content: This inexpensive camera is perfect for travel and takes exceptional photos. I'm really impressed with this camera. My photos and video are excellent and it fits in my pocket for those spur of the moment photos. I have two Fuji cameras that I love, but they're a bit bulky and I've always wanted a smaller camera. I hightly recommend this camera as it's very easy to use and seems very durable.

Reviews.Title: DMC-FP1 Great Camera at Great Price
Reviews.Author: CEdward
Reviews.Content: Fantastic camera for MOST applications. With many advanced features including it's 4X zoom and 12MP, this perfect pocket camera will make short work of 85% of the tasks you put to it. Unfortunately, even with the stabilizer and burst mode, action photography is best left to more advances DSLR's. But for a hundred bucks, you can't go wrong!

Reviews.Title: Loved canon pics, but lenses break...this is a good option so far
Reviews.Author: Tony Pearson
Reviews.Content: We loved the canon powershots until we had a lens failure...then read just how common that is. The panasonic lens is protected and a friend recommended their cameras. So far so good. It's a little less user friendly to get a great shot than the canon, but you can get great shots, you just need to navigate the settings a little. Frankly it's not difficult, just more difficult than the canon we'd become accustomed to. I like this camera a lot...it had butter not break!

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-FP1
Reviews.Author: Tom M.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to replace a 9 year-old, 2MP Canon CoolPix 775; this is definitely a step up from a measly 2MP. Camera is thin, lightweight, and very portable. I was looking for a decent camera for around $100, and this fits the bill. The camera shoots okay 720p video; a bit grainy but passable. The microphone is great for conversation level sound, but it can't handle loud noises (I used it at an NHRA Drag Racing event, where noise levels can reach over 140 decibels. Check that out on YouTube.)Bottom line: If you're looking for a simple, inexpensive point-and-shoot camera, I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Monchichipox
Reviews.Content: I have a much more expensive digital camera but, you guessed it, it sits in the box.  And the camera on my new cellphone just isn't up to par.  I love this one.  About the size of a credit card and just a little fatter.  You don't even notice it in your front pocket.  I always have it and don't miss a shot.  Look I could see needing my SLR camera if I was the staff photographer for the White House but to be honest I don't know any amateur taking fun snaps who needs a camera better than this.

Reviews.Title: Good Cam for casual use
Reviews.Author: PH
Reviews.Content: Hello All,I bought this about 3 months back. So far I have clicked around 500 pics with it.The camera is really light, has a good battery life and is very easy to use.The optical zoom is quite good.On the negative side... Sometimes the pictures clicked during night-time do not have bright colors.All in all... Gr8 product for a gr8 price and good for people who dont wanna do professional photography.

Reviews.Title: Good for $79.99
Reviews.Author: Ala58
Reviews.Content: I like the camera and purchased for a gift. The price was great at $79.99 but I noticed when I went to purchase another for myself the price jumped up by $20  I would wait till it drops down again for the best deal. An older camera should go down not up since now many cameras, including this ones twin, are up to over 14 MP. I like the camera and is excellent but sometimes indoor can be a bit fuzzy but overall the lens itself is amazing

Reviews.Title: Decent Camera
Reviews.Author: David Lee
Reviews.Content: A decent camera for daily snapshots.  Image quality is comparable to other brands in similar class/price range.  Large LCD screen is a big plus.  Recommended for casual events. Touch screen of the higher model does not warrant the higher price and is not that useful.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Amarilis
Reviews.Content: This is a great product from Panasonic. I bought it after reviewing the December issue of Consumer Report (CR) and it is everything and more than CR's review. Is simply great.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler "Traveler"
Reviews.Content: This is a little camera that take great pictures, both in daylight and at night.  Easy to use and is quickly ready to take pictures once you turn it on - very little lag time.  Smart functions are very helpful and make it easy to take a great picture.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use digital camera
Reviews.Author: DigitalSage
Reviews.Content: Nice digital camera easy to use with not much fuss!I use it as a backup camera for portability.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Mauricio M. Silva "mmartins98"
Reviews.Content: No problems at all. A reliable item and in according to the specifications. You can use it any hour of the day, with any situation because it's so easy to transport in any pocket.

Reviews.Title: Nice lil camera!
Reviews.Author: FAR
Reviews.Content: A friend purchased this camera so I am only doing a cursory review. The camera looked nice and compact. Feature wise it compares with more expensive models. This particular model is made by a subsidiary of Panasonic using Panny/Leica glass. For everyday users who want to capture quick photos this will do the trick.

Reviews.Title: Flimsy
Reviews.Author: L. Walker "Girl Progeny"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes good pics and video HOWEVER it is very flimsy. I bought this for my daughter and she dropped it the same day we got it and it is shot. Also, I merely touched the lens (the camera was giving a system error zoom message) and my nail made a serious indentation/scratch on the lens!!! I've had many digital cameras in many different price ranges and unfortunately all have dropped at least once, the difference is that with them I still had a working camera, this one I did not. Waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Vani
Reviews.Content: Got this camera after my samsung camera broke, and I think I love this camera more than the samsung one i had.  The Panasonic Lumix is perfect for regular pictures, take it on vacations etc.  I especially wanted this one because it has HD recording, awesome for concerts.  The only thing I dislike is that I need to save up to buy a larger memory card since my 4gb card only can hold 8 mins of vid footage.  But yeah I understand that I need to get the bigger memory card since its HD recording.  I recommend this camera! good point & shoot, and simple for not so tech savvy people

Reviews.Title: For $79, completely worth it
Reviews.Author: mariposazul
Reviews.Content: I am completely impressed with this little camera. My canon powershot broke recently, and I needed to replace it but didn't have a lot of money. The settings and extras on this camera are great given the relatively small price. Shoots good (not great) video. The white balance in the pictures can be a little wonky, so you do have to play around and find what setting works best for you. (Having kids, the sports mode helps a great deal). At the price I paid, definitely a steal.

Reviews.Title: Perfect "Point n' Shoot"
Reviews.Author: Anthony Hoogenboom
Reviews.Content: Great camera for use as a Point n Shoot. The "intelligent auto" mode is perfect for people who snap away at all sorts of events/settings.However, if you like to customize settings at all. This is not your camera. I couldn't find any settings for shutter, exposure, or f-stop.The good news is that the intelligent auto does its thing so well that you won't be missing those settings unless you're a serious photographer.Perfect camera for Grandma...

Reviews.Title: great camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: kateh
Reviews.Content: Portability was my top priority when buying a new camera (my old one was purchased nearly seven years ago, so just about anything would have better picture quality).  So, I was shocked when this camera first came in the mail...while i already knew it would be small based on other reviews, it was smaller than i had expected and exactly the size i had hoped for.  The camera is about the same size as the Blackberry Curve--I had forgotten to order a camera case, and it's a snug fit, but the Blackberry Curve pocket case (the one that comes with the phone) can tightly hold the camera.  For most of my trip, I could slip the camera into my fleece pocket for quick access without the bulkiness of something tugging at my jacket.Another feature that I really like about this camera is the sliding cover.  For me, this was a nice way to turn on the camera quickly without fumbling around the buttons and an equally easy way to turn off the camera when I was done.  I was reminded of the Nikon commercial with Ashton Kutcher where the women around him would stealthily take pictures of him and then slip their cameras back into their purses before he turned around.  Very quick reaction time for on/off and picture taking.Haven't played with any of the more advanced features, so I can't comment on their number or quality.  One drawback of the camera may be the zoom...because it so compact, I felt it was much better for taking basic scenic shots vs. more detailed, focused ones.Overall, a great functional camera for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: Great Value at current price
Reviews.Author: Charlie McNulty
Reviews.Content: At it's present holiday price this is a very good value.It's best attribute is it small size.  Definitely will easily fit into any pocket.  The lens cover, which acts as an on/off switch, protects the lens so you shouldn't scratch it up while in your pocket or purse.Image quality is OK for its class. It tends to blow out the highlights, particularly when the sky is part of the scene. In well lit daylight, photos are very good, particularly if you do a little post-processing.Remember, its a digicam, not a DSLR or an EVIL camera.  I have two Nikon DSLRs and they obviously have immensely better image quality.I got this to have an inexpensive "always with me" camera.  For this price it is great.  If you want better image quality, get a higher end Lumix or a Canon S95.If you just want to take photos, get this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Performance
Reviews.Author: Andy Sarria
Reviews.Content: It's my third digital camera, my first Panasonic, and generally has a good performance, great color, The intelligent function work well, maybe the bad point is the video recording, that doesn't allow to make zoom while you record a movie clip, also you can't pause the video, it start over again and limit the video to 8 minutes. I thought that is the only negative point, all the others function work excellent.

Reviews.Title: All the features I needed
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for a couple of months and it's everything I was looking for: fixed lense, manually sliding lens cover, sturdy, rocker zoom, good lens, optical stabilizer

Reviews.Title: Does Not Work
Reviews.Author: phillevey
Reviews.Content: This camera simply does not work. After charging and inserting the battery in the camera according to the instructions, the LCD screen would come on for 1 or 2 seconds and then go dark. Pressing any or all of the buttons had no effect. Neither did recharging the battery. I called Amazon and they promptly sent a replacement. The replacement worked for one day and the pictures were good. After that, however, I had the same problem with the replacement coming on for 1 or 2 seconds and then the LCD screen would go dark. So, I now have to go through the hassle of trying to return the replacement. Despite the good reviews, I think there is definitely a quality control problem with this camera and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Lousy product
Reviews.Author: Either C, or D.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on the basis of consumer reports reviews which said it was a good camera and very reliable. I had been _extremely_ satisfied with my canon SD elph, but I'm rough on cameras and the elph had broken down one too many times -- the telescoping lens on the elph was the failure point, twice. I returned the canon to factory for repair but at 100 dollars a pop it was way too close to buying a new camera -- the lumix design with the lens inside the body housing seemed like a solution to me, and the reviews confirmed it. Instead the camera is such crap that I've not only lost faith in panasonic but in consumer reports as well. (To be fair to consumer reports the canon was a consumer reports recommendation that lived up to the promise).Why is this camera crap?Day 1, picture 1, I instantly saw the picture quality as a major step down from the canon. A dramatic step down -- The lens is simply not sharp, the colors are less accurate and lively. The picture quality is so unexciting that I stopped taking pictures -- I didn't even realize I'd made that choice, but I stopped taking pictures because it wasn't fun. The video is equally bad, and on top of it it is saved in the .mov format, which is NOT a friendly format for PC users... if you are a power user, or a Mac user (i think, I'm not a mac guy, but .mov is a quicktime format which I believe is mac), it won't be a big issue... if you aren't the kind of person who likes installing video codecs -- stay away.Secondly... I treated this camera gently, not wanting to repeat my canon probs... Within months it stopped autofocusing correctly... and it was hard to figure out what was wrong, it seemed like I must be doing something wrong, but it has become obvious that it is a SOFTWARE issue (when I reboot the camera with on/off -- it autofocuses correctly for one picture and then it stops focusing).A software breakdown on a point and shoot? I do not need this garbage. Truly. Crappy pictures when it worked and then it broke in less than 6 months. 1 star.I recently bought a new canon SD Elph and a nice little protective case for it! It looks great and I'm taking pictures again.I swear upon everything I hold sacred I am not a canon employee/contractor or in anyway marketting their product nor do I have a grudge against panasonic other than them selling me this awful camera.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix fp-1
Reviews.Author: Candido Rodriguez "NYCDTSGT"
Reviews.Content: Ive had this camera for about 1 month now.- Its great for the money I paid.(Make sure you wait for a sale). It takes great pictures(12) megapixel and the zoom 5:1 is more then enough for average picture takers. The Lcd is big and bright. Battery life is good(rechargeable battery). I havent used the software yet to download any pictures onto my PC. So far this camera doesn't dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: Ok for a year or two
Reviews.Author: A. Ng "tradhead"
Reviews.Content: It took fine pictures for a year or two and then the picture quality got worse and worse, due to something electronic (not simply a dirty lens). But even at its best it was not generally not as good quality as, say, an iPhone camera.

Reviews.Title: Goes Up In Value Over Time
Reviews.Author: Bill Baehr "whipperin1"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 3 years and it has been just great. The battery/sd card door broke after about 18 months and I just tape it on and it works fine. I owned two Canon point and shoot cameras before this Lumix unit and they both failed me within 2 years. The lens failed to come out on them and they quit working completely. POS! I work in dusty Wyoming and carry and use this camera often. The photos this Lumix takes are very good and the videos are good enough. It's a simple camera to operate and I like that. What's amazing is I paid $79 for it in 2010 and it's $149 today. How often does that happen with a camera?

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: superawesomeguy
Reviews.Content: Pros:Great picturesGood 'shaky hand' controlNight mode with an adjustable shutter speed lets you take amazing night landscape picturesCons:A bit priceyNot great for super-casual point-and-shoot photos (takes a second to focus)Bottom line:If you want something to take crappy facebook photos go spend $50 on a Nikon. If actual photography is important to you then buy this!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Shaheen12
Reviews.Content: I wrote this review after I got a smart phone and I got this phone before I had one. First and foremost, I think smartphones have already killed point and shoots but i'll make the review for the camera not the circumstance.pros+east to use+good megapixel for the time I bought it (2010)+the lense cover is clutchcons-size, i hated carrying it around which is why i got a smartphone, among other reasons.Great product but too bad smartphones killed a big part of the market for these.

Reviews.Title: a Good Basic Camera
Reviews.Author: droyh21
Reviews.Content: although it took a little time to figure out hold the camera so that fingers were not in the way, this camera took good pictures and the various features (zoom, etc) worked well

Reviews.Title: Yes, but handle with care.
Reviews.Author: suenosdeuomi
Reviews.Content: Dropped it the first week, so beware handle with care. A cute little camera go way too little use due to my bad.

Reviews.Title: my favorite walking in place i can get robbed camera ever
Reviews.Author: Fernando C. Cardoso
Reviews.Content: so i bought this together with a lumix lx5. of course it is not a competitor in the quality of the photos of this other amazing camera but is a great camera for packed streets and other dubious places. it survived me for 2 years so far and around 15000 photos. mine is completely scratched but it is still working. the lcd screen dont do justice to the photos. when i see them in a computer they are always better than in the screen. the colours are not the most exciting part of it but for me that like black and white for street scenes this is a non issue. the menus are easy to navigate. the assistant red light is kind of strong and in fact night shots are not for this camera but it is still a 5 star product.

Reviews.Title: We loved it, until the on/off switch broke
Reviews.Author: R. McGowan
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera, and we loved it. Takes great pictures, is very compact, etc. After about 2.5 years the on/off switch or something broke and it won't turn on any longer. Panasonic wanted $128 for out of warranty repair.

Reviews.Title: genial
Reviews.Author: maria medina
Reviews.Content: lo encontre en amamzon y la utilizo casi todos los dias, tiene una gran calidad de imagen y de color

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: T. Hoefer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas, but found that I enjoy using as well. It is very easy to use and takes great shots!

Reviews.Title: You can do better....avoid Panasonic altogether
Reviews.Author: Jane Long
Reviews.Content: This will be an okay camera until your flash stops working, which it will. The usable life of your camera will be shorted abruptly by this. Panasonic is aware of the issue, but don't expect any support from them.

Reviews.Title: I don't leave home without it..
Reviews.Author: George S
Reviews.Content: what a deal, very nice compact camera, it's rugged, has a big touch-screen, the functions and settings are easy to navigate thru the intuitive menu, i totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Falls Short
Reviews.Author: justletmeread
Reviews.Content: After owning the older version of the Panasonic point and shoot, I was stoked to buy another when my first one died. This camera is such a disappointment. The lens is completely unimpressive. The pictures are lack luster, and the zoom is worthless.  Don't  waste your money on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Lumix Picture quality not up to my standards.
Reviews.Author: Ernst Ghermann
Reviews.Content: I bought this neat little camera about a year ago. It fits in my shirt pocket and I carry it with me a lot. However, I am very disappointed in the picture quality. The pictures taken with this Lumix 12 megapixel camera are not nearly as sharp as the ones I took with my old 8 megapixel Canon Power Shot A530.  That Canon camera finally failed by insisting that the batteries needed charging even when they were new. I loved that camera because it produced high quality pictures and had a see through view finder. I would have bought that camera again had it still been made. I have trouble seeing the display screens in daylight and see through viewfinders are now only available on high end cameras. I am now looking to replace the Lumix because of my frustration with the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Almost a perfect pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Arclight
Reviews.Content: Easy to hold, built in lens cover, excellent HD video, great photos, reliable, and inexpensive enough to take places without worrying about it.What keeps it from being perfect? Two things:1) The microphone for video recording cannot handle low frequency sounds. It causes horrible buzzing on the recorded video. You can video a band playing just fine, until the bass player kicks in. for example. Not impressed with the engineering on this.2) The IA shooting mode is only usable for daylight and some bright interior shots. At night, and often indoors you often get circular dust flares in the image. The workaround is to use the "normal" mode or perhaps the "party" mode for these. The IA mode also produces blurred images occasionally. I now leave the camera in "normal" mode by default.A good camera to buy, with those caveats.

Reviews.Title: Good buy for the price
Reviews.Author: RB "RB"
Reviews.Content: Bought this about a few months back as a gift for somebody. Obviously you don't want to spend hundreds on a gift for someone - depends who that someone is ;) . Anyways it is an awesome buy, never expected it to be so good considering what I paid - less than a hundred including taxes and 4gb memory. Takes decent pictures, okay under low light. I can zoom in movie mode which I can't do with my Sony W290. Overall a decent, handy P&S; camera. Great for folks who do not like to change too many settings too often.

Reviews.Title: Nice pictures
Reviews.Author: Cookie14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a cheap camara and for that I was not expecting good quality pictures but surprise! This camara takes good pictures, it was cheap and it is easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera.
Reviews.Author: M. Trembley
Reviews.Content: I've had a lot of great cameras, and this one is my favorite so far.  I was waiting for one for a long time that would meet all my requirements, and this one fits.  I needed something with very good low light performance.  Also, I realized after having a lot of small cameras that I needed a *really* thin one like this so that I quit taking it out of my pocket and losing it.  Everyone loves the pictures this thing takes.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: great camera with hd video
Reviews.Author: Victor Gomez "victor ml gomez a"
Reviews.Content: this little camera works as it should it takes great pics and video is great although 720p only it is light and the lens cover is a good feature

Reviews.Title: Fantastic for outdoor/daytime and indoor use
Reviews.Author: S. M. Pitman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to mount in my race car to record sanctioned race events. I wanted something that would record 720p video directly to a flash card. Not only has this worked perfectly, but the convenient size and between-good-and-great image quality have made it my go-to camera when I don't want to carry my dSLR around. Now I keep this in the glove-box of my car now so I always have a camera where ever I am.Just remember that you're not buying a top-of-the-line camera. Treat it well because it's not invincible, and don't expect to win any photo competitions with it. High ISO images for night shooting are marginal at best and it doesn't have the same options that a more expensive camera has. The flash is good for indoor use only, don't be disappointed if you try to shoot an outdoor pool party and nothing comes out right; that's your fault for not understanding what you're buying.This is a small aperture point-and-shoot for your pocket/purse/glove-box with awesome video capability.

Reviews.Title: Thin and nice. Great buy.
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I had a Lumix camera before and like it very much. I bought this one for my son. It's thin and nice look.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: JimB
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera for the price. As far as durability, time will tell. Have had the camera less than a month.

Reviews.Title: Great value camera
Reviews.Author: baker
Reviews.Content: This Lumix does a great job all around.  It was purchased to go on vacation, and I'm certain it will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: Bought the Panasonic Lumix for my Daughter for Christmas
Reviews.Author: Annie
Reviews.Content: My daughter seems to be very happy with this camera.  She loves the size as it fits in her evening purses.

Reviews.Title: To soon to tell
Reviews.Author: G. Bost "Happy"
Reviews.Content: Really can't judge...it was gift for someone. She seems happy with it, although they can't transfer a video to their PC.  Don't know whether its the video format or the PC.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Fritz The Cat
Reviews.Content: Small, great build quality, excellent pictures, easy to use. Excellent valueI only wish it used standard batteries. But if it did it wouldn't be as thin as it is so I guess I can live with the proprietary battery.

Reviews.Title: Good, but...
Reviews.Author: R. Zhang "mushroom"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our parents and they don't speak English or Spanish.. Good pocket camera. Very thin and easy to use. However, it only has English and Spanish langyage options. And no firmware update on their website.

Reviews.Title: Love this little cam !
Reviews.Author: Vicky
Reviews.Content: It is my first digital cam, and I am amazed by its picture quality.Love this little powerhouse, and impressed by its design. It rocks big time.

Reviews.Title: Does what it does for cheap!
Reviews.Author: J. Buys
Reviews.Content: Great cam for the $$. Well built great software as always.My only complaint is no manual controls like Lumix previous small cams. but for 79.00, who cares!

Reviews.Title: Nice design, poor photo quality
Reviews.Author: J. Keil
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera, but it let me down. I read a lot of reviews and thought, for $79 why not? The design is great...small, light, fits in the pocket nicely. Main issue is the photo quality was poor. No two shots came out alike, with differing colors and lighting. The intelligent automode does not work the greatest, as it gives mixed picture quality. I will be returning it as I have yet to take a good photo with it....and note I used this over the holidays and got not one good image. I am going to buy the Canon SD1400...it was more expensive, but worth the money if you ask me.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price
Reviews.Author: klemster
Reviews.Content: This camera is user friendly and takes great pictures. Quality exceeded expectations for the price.

Reviews.Title: Its a very good camera.
Reviews.Author: Mark Kramer
Reviews.Content: This is overall a nice camera. 12 megapixels. It is not touch screen. IT DOESNT COME WITH A MEMORY CARD. I HIGLY SUGGEST TO GET A MEMORY CARD!!!!!!!! The camera takes good pictures and good videos. They video sounds are high quality. It also has a feature were you can digital zoom which makes it go up to 16x zoom. Its nice. It is slim so it can fit into your pocket nicely. OVER ALL ITS A NICE CMAMERA!

Reviews.Title: BY FAR THE WORST CAMERA I'VE OWNED
Reviews.Author: paintergirl
Reviews.Content: BEWARE - This camera is awful and frustrating to use!  It is completely non-intuitive.  Nothing about using it is easy.  Setting and adjusting functions takes many complicated steps.  None of the buttons feature images that are useful to identifying their function with the exception of the flash.  But the worst thing about it is the color perception is way off.  I am a painter and purchased it, in part, to photograph paintings to load to my website.  This camera completely misreads the colors of the paintings I am photographing.  A cad yellow orange comes off as a lemon/light yellow.  I've tried all the color adjustments - warm, vivid, natural - and NO setting accurately photographs the image color or frankly even comes close. I've tried photographing with and without flash, natural setting, dark interior setting.  Nothing works to get an accurate image.  I'm ready to toss it!

Reviews.Title: Good at Day Time Less at Night
Reviews.Author: Bibilui
Reviews.Content: The first reason I bought this camera was because it's cheap and has the feature that I am sort of looking for. I didn't like it at the beginning because I thought the design was a bit too square for me and the screen was blurry not until you focus it. I however started to like this camera as it takes good photos during the day with the right setting. I personally think that FP1 doesn't do good at night but sometimes it works wonders with flash especially when you're taking pictures indoor. Developing pictures are fine for me but I still think it depends on the quality of the paper used. The HD video recording is superb but no zoom is allow while on action and the volume were quite low. It was overall a good camera for an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: A Major Problem with SDHC Cards
Reviews.Author: Cheapie
Reviews.Content: I kept buying SDHC cards thinking that my cards were bad because they ended up being "write protected" after already used with the camera. So far I have bought 3 SDHC cards: 4GB, 8GB, and 16 GB because of this. Now that the third one became "write protected", I began suspecting that the camera had done something to my cards. The cards can still be used inside the camera and within the camera, the pictures can still be deleted. But if these cards are removed and plugged into my laptop SD reader slot, they are always seen as write protected by my laptop.Therefore, once a card is plugged into this camera, that card belongs to the camera use only. I cannot believe Panasonic makes a camera that makes SD cards useless for PC use later on. By the way, I have tried reformatting the cards using the camera itself but it appears to just delete files without truly reformatting.

Reviews.Title: Good price, annoying touchscreen
Reviews.Author: Sramr5
Reviews.Content: This camera is ultra portable and looks sleek, BUT I cannot stand the touch screen! It is not sensitive at all and does not give the option of using real buttons instead. It is hard to zoom in to look at your pictures. I would suggest a different camera. The quality of pictures is fairly good, however.

Reviews.Title: This camera is a very good choice
Reviews.Author: Lenin
Reviews.Content: This camera is a very good choice, easy to handle, multilingual menu, very nice pictures, what can i say, Just what I want

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: Kevin Chan
Reviews.Content: This camera is very good for the money.Parts of the camera feel cheapLCD color is very subpar, user function doesnt seem as friendly as other brandsBUTthis little bugger takes fantastic sharp crisp images.

Reviews.Title: Steady Shots
Reviews.Author: InsAgent
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd of this manufacturers product I have purchased. 1st one was liked more by someone else. The screen is large enough and the setting are easy to make. The SD card I had for other reasons does not work well, so ensure that you purcahse the right one. So far so good.

Reviews.Title: Good, with some annoying stuff
Reviews.Author: no so-called
Reviews.Content: Good, simple camera. The only thing that bugs me about the camera itself is that you can't change the zoom while taking a video, which you can do on the more upmarket Lumix offerings.That's the physical camera. When you take it home to get the pictures off it, the experience degrades.This camera comes with a USB cable, but you can't access it as a USB disk volume. For some insane reason, Panasonic chose to make the user experience as bad as possible by forcing you to access the camera only via some application they ship on a CD with the camera. It's called "PHOTOFunSTUDIO", capitalized just like that. I don't know how bad the application is, because it refuses to install on my computer: It pops up a message box whining about how it will only let you install it on Windows XP or Vista (the print manual claims Windows 7 as well, but the installer only mentions XP and Vista). I have Win2K3. What morons. There is no legitimate reason for an XP/Vista application not to run on Win2K3. The manual also says the software won't run on "64 bit operation [sic] systems", Win2K  or NT 4, any of the old consumer versions of Windows from the 90s, or "the multi-monitor environments". You read that correctly: In 2011, these people don't feel any need to support multiple monitors. Panasonic's software people are aggressively incompetent imbeciles. They get up early each morning to figure out what they can screw up that day, and then they screw up something else, because they're such cretins they can't even get their errors right.Oh, and it wants to install QuickTime too, as if I don't already have more than enough idiotic Apple malware constantly crashing and downloading and trying to install even further perversions.

ProductInfo.Features:
Optical Zoom 4x; Extra Optical Zoom 4.9x, 6.3x, 7.8x / 4x Digital Zoom / 4x optical has focal length of 35-140mm in 35mm equiv
Optical Image Stabilizer-2 MEGA O.I.S. (Off / Auto / Mode1 / Mode2) Photo and Movie modes
Focus Range Display / AF Metering / Focus - Normal / Macro, Zoom Macro, Quick AF (Always On) / AF Assist Lamp
ISO Sensitivity Auto / 80 / 100 / 200 / 400 / 800 / 1600 / High Sensitivity (ISO 1600-6400)
White Balance Auto / Daylight / Cloudy / Shade / Halogen / White Set
Selectable at Portrait, Soft Skin, Transform, Self-Portrait, Sports, Baby, Pet, High Sensitivity, High-speed Burst, Photo Frame mode
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FP1 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)
